concept.title: What's new in version 1.0.0.1
concept.shortdesc: Learn about the main new functions in version 1.0.0.1.

dd.p: You can verify the installation of your appliance by running the Messaging Tester application. This application simulates client interaction with the appliance. Connected clients can publish and subscribe on a number of topics. For more information about verifying the installation of by using the Messaging Tester application, see .

You can use retained messages to enable the most recent retained message on a topic to be immediately forwarded to subscribers that subscribe after the message was published. supports both MQTT and JMS retained messages. For more information about developing retained message applications, see Developing retained message applications. You can send retained messages between and . For more information about sending retained messages between and , see MQ Connectivity retained messages.
You can write your own monitoring applications to monitor topic, endpoint, and appliance data remotely. For more information about remote monitoring, see Monitoring and reporting.

You can monitor destination mapping rules. monitoring can aid problem determination in an enterprise where and are used. For example, by highlighting any destination mapping rules that are not operating normally. For more information about monitoring, see MQ Connectivity monitoring.

dlentry.dt: Setting and retrieving SSH host information by using the .

dd.p: You can use the to set and retrieve information about the IP address or addresses that must be used to connect to the appliance over SSH. For more information about setting and retrieving SSH host information, see Setting and retrieving the SSH host address.

You can test a queue manager connection to ensure that a connection can be made to a specified queue manager. You can test an existing queue manager connection, or you can test the parameters of a connection before you create the queue manager connection. You can test a queue manager connection by using the command line, or by using the . For more information, see Testing a queue manager connection by using the command line.

conbody.p: For more information about changes in version 1.0.0.1, see What's changed in version 1.0.0.1.
